word:
Until Perfection of Character Is Reached. At this time in the history of the world, we should have but one object in view--to gain eternal life. Every other desire should be subordinate to this. The work of regeneration must go on in every soul until perfection of character is reached; for 


                                     -339- 

nothing short of this will meet the mind of God.--Manuscript 119, 1899, p. 1. ("Words to Parents," August 21, 1899.)
